Description: Glazed composition model of two vase: joined together at the mouth, with handles running from the rims to the shoulders. The entire object is pierced right through from the base of one vase to the base of the other as if for threading on a string. The surfaces of the vases are decorated with shallow grooves, in which traces of the original green glaze survives, the majority having decayed to pale brown.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Osiris-Khentimentu (Abydos), Chamber M69 deposit
Curator's comments: This suggestion was made by Scharff as an alternative to Petrie's view that the objects might be 'toggles for fastening a dress through a loop'. It is more likely that these objects were purely votive, as must have been the other types of model vases from the same deposit. For similar objects, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), pl.VIII, 142-3 (object in Berlin), A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’ II (Berlin, 1929-31), no. 153 and pl.29; G. Brunton, 'Qau and Badari' I (London, 1927), pl.XVIII, 14; G. Dreyer, 'Mitteilungen der Deutschen Archäologischen Instituts Abteilung Kairo' 32 (Wiesbaden, 1976), 86, VII (c) and pl.26d, right. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), 26 and pl. VIII, 141;
